[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Overall design] [PVSS security] Does the key structure properly implement the PVSS security properties (verifiability, secrecy, correctness), or are there gaps in the cryptographic design? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Struct relationships] [Key binding] Is there a cryptographic binding between DecryptPrivKey, EncryptPubKey, and DealtPubKey that prevents key substitution attacks in multi-party DKG? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Type system] [Lack of newtype pattern] Do the simple type aliases and minimal wrapper structs allow protocol-level confusion between different key types (encryption vs dealt vs secret)? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Overall design] [Replay protection] Does the key structure include any mechanism to prevent replay attacks where old DKG transcripts are resubmitted in new epochs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Trait: ValidCryptoMaterial] [Network serialization] When EncryptPubKey is transmitted over the network, can bit flips or partial writes create invalid keys that cause validator nodes to crash or diverge? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Function: try_from()] [Byzantine validator attack] Can a Byzantine validator broadcast multiple different EncryptPubKey deserializations from the same byte array, causing honest validators to have inconsistent views of the DKG state? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Struct: EncryptPubKey] [Equivocation] Can a malicious validator generate multiple valid EncryptPubKeys from the same DecryptPrivKey by exploiting non-determinism in the conversion process? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Function: try_from()] [Empty input] What happens if try_from() receives an empty byte slice - does it fail gracefully or cause undefined behavior? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Function: try_from()] [Oversized input] Can an attacker provide a byte array much larger than needed, causing excessive processing or memory allocation during deserialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Output size] Is there a guaranteed upper bound on the serialized size returned by to_bytes(), or could malicious inputs create unbounded output? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Struct: DecryptPrivKey] [Maximum value] What happens if generate() produces a scalar equal to the field modulus minus one - are there any edge cases in subsequent operations? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Generic bounds] [Future-proofing] If Aptos needs to migrate to a different elliptic curve pairing in the future, does the generic Pairing bound allow smooth transition, or will there be security gaps? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Trait: ValidCryptoMaterial] [Version handling] Does the empty AIP_80_PREFIX (line 25) prevent protocol versioning, making it impossible to upgrade the key format without a hard fork? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Function: to()] [Timing attack] Does the scalar multiplication on line 69 run in constant time, or can timing side channels leak information about the secret decryption key dk? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Function: try_from()] [Deserialization timing] Can timing differences in deserialize_compressed() failure cases (line 38) reveal information about valid vs invalid public keys? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Struct: DecryptPrivKey] [Memory layout] Does the compiler optimize away zeroization of the secret key dk, or can the SilentDebug/SilentDisplay macros inadvertently expose key material? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Overall] [Transcript verification] When these keys are used in PVSS transcripts, are the public keys properly committed to prevent key substitution attacks after dealing? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Overall] [Threshold security] Do these key structures properly support t-of-n threshold security, or can edge cases in key reconstruction break the threshold property? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Struct: DealtSecretKeyShare] [Share verification] Can validators verify that their DealtSecretKeyShare is consistent with the DealtPubKey without revealing the share value? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Overall] [Complaint mechanism] If a validator detects an invalid encryption key or dealt share, does the protocol provide a mechanism to prove misbehavior without compromising security? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Function: to_bytes()] [Panic safety] The unwrap() on line 29 panics on error - can this be triggered by an attacker to cause validator nodes to crash during critical DKG phases? (High)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Derives: line 17] [PartialEq implementation] Does the derived PartialEq for EncryptPubKey properly handle affine coordinate comparison, or can different representations of the same point be considered unequal? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Derives: line 75] [Clone semantics] Does the derived Clone for DealtPubKey perform a deep copy of the G2Affine point, or could shallow copying lead to aliasing issues? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/crates/aptos-dkg/src/pvss/chunky/keys.rs] [Macros: line 46] [SilentDebug safety] Do the SilentDebug and SilentDisplay macros on DecryptPrivKey properly prevent accidental logging of secret keys in error messages or debug output? (High)
